description: ERECTION OF REAR EXTENSION, CLOSING OFF EXISTING WINDOWS AND INSTALLATION OF NEW DOOR. EXTERNAL WORKS.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site location plan and drawings 28_BFA 01 090 Rev PLO, 28_BFA 01 100 Rev PLO, 28_BFA 01 101 Rev PLO, 28_BFA 01 200 Rev PLO, 28_BFA 01 201 Rev PLO & 28_BFA 01 300 Rev PLO

Condition : 2 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in the flank elevations without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with informal pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
